intro: Weinmannia guyanensis var. guyanensis, commonly known as the Guyana Weinmannia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly the Amazon Basin. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in humid, tropical environments. The plant features compound leaves with alternate arrangement and small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale yellow. Its botanical characteristics include a woody stem, hairy foliage, and a preference for well-drained, acidic soils. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and animals.
